result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A Fortney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad A Fortney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad A Fortney was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Chad A Fortney was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Chad A Fortney in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading waived on Amended Information. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3 Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 years probation, conditions: $253 and $90 costs, $160.05 restitution. $500 posted bond applied to costs and restitution. Ct. 1 dismissed.  No Jail credit.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek, requesting a plea/sentencing be set.  (Was filed at end of day in person).

Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared. Crystal Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Riek stated she will need to meet w/defendant one more time, will have answer on speedy trial demand by Monday, Atty Long has no objection, Atty Long states witnesses have not been served, Court states Atty Riek to contact Court by 8:30 A.M. re: defendant's status, also to contact Atty Long

Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in custody and not present, Court finds good cause for defendant to not be present. Atty Long states witnesses may not be available for jury trial, Atty Riek had originally objected to reset request but has not been able to contact client due to his incarceration, Atty Riek to make contact w/defendant tomorrow, Atty Riek to notify the Court and Attorney Long if defendant is still requesting speedy trial demand, Court will make determination after tomorrow, Atty Riek addresses motions filed, Atty Riek to provide transcript w/recording if needed,

Defendant Chad A Fortney in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Long argued phone is evidence and probative. Atty. Riek responded. Court allowed State 30 days to get what they need from the phone. If phone the capability to text msg, State will be allowed to keep the phone to display it to the jury. If not, phone records could show contact with the victim.

Defendant Chad A Fortney in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness.  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Redirect examination.  Recross examination.  Court found probable cause.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
